  • Movement: A 30min beginner’s dance class starts at 7:30p. After the lesson, the dance floor will stay open until 10:30p. Wear your most colorful attire or flower prints in honor of the current exhibition Diego Rivera’s America!

The event is free, but tickets must be reserved in advance. Get yours HERE.
node.name: Latin Dance Adventures

node.description: The Gulley Park Concert Series continues this week with Ashtyn Barbaree on Thursday, Jul 13, from 7-9p.
node.name: Gulley Park Concert Series

node.description:
Enjoy a bilingual performance of the classic children's tale Peter & The Wolf by the Symphony of Northwest Arkansas at Victory Theater in Downtown Rogers on Thursday, Jul 13, at 4:30p and 5:30p.

  • When & Where: The symphonic fairy tale is set to the timeless music of Sergei Prokofiev, featuring 5 players and two narrators (1 English, 1 Spanish). Each character is represented by an instrument in the orchestra — Flute, Violin, Clarinet, Cello, and French Horn.
  • Keep walking: Each performance lasts just 25 minutes. So you can make a night of it after the show by exploring local art during the Art on the Bricks July Art Walk or enjoying the Local Showcase Thursday at Railyard Live.

General admission is $5 in advance and $7 at the door. Reserve your seats HERE.
node.name: SoNA Presents Peter & The Wolf

node.description:
Iconic rock group Foreigner will make one last visit to the Walmart AMP as part of their Historic Farewell Tour with Loverboy on Jul 14.

  • Chart-toppers: Launched by three Englishmen and three Americans, Foreigner rocked the 70s and 80s with some of rock and roll’s most enduring anthems — like Juke Box Hero, Cold As Ice, Hot Blooded, Waiting For A Girl Like You, and the worldwide No. 1 hit, I Want To Know What Love Is.
  • I wanna know: Don’t miss this last chance to rock out with Foreigner as they make a stop at the Walmart AMP with Loverboy on Jul 14. Perhaps after all these years, they will tell us if they ever found out what love is.

Get your Foreigner Farewell Tour tickets HERE.
node.name: Foreigner at the Walmart AMP

node.description:
Picnic Time: A master plan draft for an update of Walker Community Park will be available for public feedback during the 16th Annual CDBG In the Park community picnic on Friday, Jul 14, from 10:30a-1:30p. Celebrate the City's contributions to the local parks and enjoy hot dogs, cool drinks, and fun activities!


Keep up with Fayetteville Parks & Rec updates HERE.
node.name: 16th Annual CDBG In the Park

node.description:
Firefly Fling Festival will illuminate the Botanical Garden of the Ozarks for one of Northwest Arkansas’s most anticipated mid-summer celebrations on Saturday, Jul 15, from 5-10p.

  • Fairyland: The Garden will transform into a magical realm, inspiring its guests to embrace the wonder of the outdoors. Get in the spirit of the event by dressing up as a fairy, pirate, superhero, or any other magical creature!
  • Enchanting: Enjoy engaging activities, dinner and treats from food trucks, and live music with Jennifer Brinkley, Katie Dwyer, and Jukebox. The night will end with a captivating performance by fire dancers and a laser light show!

Ticket prices increase the day of the event, so reserve yours in advance HERE.
node.name: Firefly Fling Festival

node.description:
Kick back Jimmy Buffet style during the first-ever Main Street Margarita Festival at The Park House Kitchen + Bar in Siloam Springs next Saturday, Jul 15, from 4-7p.

  • Mix it up: Business owners, bartenders, and mixologists will compete to earn the most votes and be named Margarita Master 2023. Think you have what it takes? Join the competition here.
  • Fiesta time: Attendees must be 21+ to attend. Tickets include access to the Park House Kitchen + Bar taco bar, a 3oz tasting glass to sample a variety of margaritas, and tokens to vote for your favorites!

Tickets are $35 per person. Get yours HERE.
node.name: Main Street Margarita Festival

node.description:
Celebrate the Scott Family Amazeum's 8th Birthday with clay-themed activities like clay earring-cutting, pottery wheel throwing, cake decorating, and more on Saturday, Jul 15, from 10a-5p.

  • Learn & Play: The Amazeum in Bentonville is a hands-on, interactive museum for families featuring a climbable tree canopy, indoor cave, the 3M Tinkering Hub, Hershey’s Lab, Nickelodeon PlayLab, the Market sponsored by Walmart, and nearly one acre of outdoor space.
  • Birthday Bash: The party will have curated sensory bins, clay cake decorating, pottery wheel throwing with Wheel Mobile, polymer clay earring cutting with Judy & Jean, and Breyers ice cream!

Learn more about the Scott Family Amazeum HERE.
node.name: Scott Family Amazeum's 8th Birthday Party

node.description:
Find community while pursuing fitness goals by joining Movement Class at the ArtCourt on Dickson in Fayetteville, led by movement coach Philip Shepherd every Saturday at 10:30a from May 6 - Sep 23. 

  • Let’s get moving: Movement Classes include exercise drills intended to improve joint health and range of motion while building full-body strength and coordination through fun, interactive, and accessible workouts. 
  • All together now: Community is key to reaching fitness goals no matter where you’re starting your journey. All exercises can be scaled down for beginners or scaled up to more difficult variations, and teamwork is highly encouraged. 

Everyone's first class is FREE, and affordable pricing begins at $10 per class, a four-class pass for $30, and 12 classes for $75. Learn more about Movement Class HERE.
node.name: Movement Class at the ArtCourt

node.description:
Ready for warmer weather so the kids can get out and play? Get ahead on your spring or summer plans by signing up for one of Peel Compton Foundation's outdoor learning experiences.

  • Natural learning: Coler Kids Camp immerses children, ages 8-12, in nature at Coler Preserve, keeping them active by learning outdoor skills. In the Explore Archery experience, teens ages 12-16 can receive archery training from certified instructors at The Quiver.
  • Adventure: Explore Osage is an exciting summer camp, providing children ages 8-12 with hands-on adventure by exploring the wetlands and learning archery at Osage Park.

Find more information and reserve spring or summer dates HERE.
node.name: Spring And Summer Camp Opportunities For Kids By Peel Compton Foundation

node.description: Chamber Music on the Mountain Festival will commemorate Mount Sequoyah’s 100th year with a weeklong festival featuring Arkansas composers and folk music traditions from Jul 17-29.
node.name: Chamber Music On The Mountain Festival

node.description:
Peddle up to the sixth-floor outdoor patio of the Ledger for a special Bike-In Cinema experience this summer on Jul 18 and Aug 8 at 7p!

  • Built to ride: The world's first bikeable building, the Ledger features six stories of switchbacks along the copper exterior of its 230,000ft2 mixed-use space, which includes private offices, coworking space, retail, and art displays.
  • Honey & Jam: The Bike-In Cinema series will show Bee Movie on Jul 18 and Space Jam on Aug 8. Doors open at 6:30p, and movies begin at 7p. Don't forget your blankets and snacks! Concessions will be available for purchase.

Tickets are $8 a piece or $5 when you buy more than four. Reserve your spot HERE.
node.name: Bike-In Cinema At The Ledger

node.description: The Gulley Park Concert Series continues this week with Funk Factory on Thursday, Jul 20, from 7-9p.
node.name: Gulley Park Concert Series

node.description: The Little Night Market by The Little Craft Show will bring live music, food, drinks, makers, and more to Likewise in Fayetteville on Jul 21.
node.name: The Little Night Market

node.description:
If you left the Rodeo of the Ozarks last month wishing for more bull-riding insanity, we've got another adrenaline-packed weekend coming to Parsons Stadium for Buckin' In The Ozarks from July 21-22.

  • Down & Dirty: An official stop for the Professional Bull Riders Pro Tour, Buckin' in the Ozarks will bring the best Bull Riders of the PBR to Springdale as they face off against the meanest bulls in the toughest sport on dirt!
  • Mount Up: Put on your boots and join the heart-pounding action and excitement at Parsons Stadium. Adult tickets start at $18, and kids 12 and under can join for only $8. The event kicks off Friday, Jul 21, at 8p.

. Get your tickets for Buckin' In The Ozarks HERE.
node.name: Buckin' in the Ozarks

node.description:
You don’t have to take an expensive trip to Napa to find your new favorite wines when you have hundreds of options to sample at one memorable event. The party starts next Friday, Jul 21, at 8p at Walton Arts Center.

  • Sip, sip, hooray! For food & wine aficionados and Northwest Arkansas newcomers, Art of Wine: Uncorked! is the ultimate night out. Sample, sip, and savor fine wines, beer, bubbles, and spirits, with snacks and desserts from local restaurants.
  • Raise a glass! All that fun isn’t for nothing. Proceeds from the event benefit Walton Arts Center’s ongoing arts education programs across Northwest Arkansas.

Reserve your tickets HERE.
node.name: Art of Wine: Uncorked!

node.description:
Back for its third year, the Northwest Arkansas MESS FEST with Macaroni KID returns for a fun-filled, messy day at Lokomotion in Fayetteville on Jul 22, from 10a-1p.

  • Join the mess: Vendors will have a variety of fun stations in the meadow at Lokomotion for kids to enjoy. Interested vendors can email Kara to apply!
  • Go crazy: Kids can enjoy getting messy with activities like shaving cream painting, mud pie station, slime, water beads, and a sandpit Dino dig.

Tickets are free but limited. Get yours HERE.
node.name: NWA Mess Fest

Find community while pursuing fitness goals by joining Movement Class at the ArtCourt on Dickson in Fayetteville, led by movement coach Philip Shepherd every Saturday at 10:30a from May 6 - Sep 23. 

  • Let’s get moving: Movement Classes include exercise drills intended to improve joint health and range of motion while building full-body strength and coordination through fun, interactive, and accessible workouts. 
  • All together now: Community is key to reaching fitness goals no matter where you’re starting your journey. All exercises can be scaled down for beginners or scaled up to more difficult variations, and teamwork is highly encouraged. 

Everyone's first class is FREE, and affordable pricing begins at $10 per class, a four-class pass for $30, and 12 classes for $75. Learn more about Movement Class HERE.
node.name: Movement Class at the ArtCourt

node.description:
Enjoy a day with the whole family and unleash your creativity with food-inspired artmaking at Crystal Bridges during the Family Day: The Art of Food event this Sunday, Jul 23, from 10a-3p.

  • Guac This Way: Family Day will kick off with an exciting Guac Off sponsored by Avocados from Peru. Local media personalities will prepare guacamole for a panel of celebrity chefs for a chance to be named the Guac Off Champion and win the coveted silver avocado.
  • Family Fun: Enjoy a live performance by beloved children's artist Hot Toast, grab lunch from local food trucks, and cool down with refreshing lemonade provided by Raising Cane's on Walker Landing.

The event is free, but guests can bring a non-perishable food item to donate to local food bank partners! Learn more HERE.
node.name: Family Day: The Art of Food
node.organization: Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art

node.description:
RYG Basketball is running a game-changing basketball camp for 5th-8th grade boys and girls at AAO Fayetteville from July 24-28, providing on and off-court development in basketball, leadership, and mindset skills for young athletes looking to raise their game.

  • On-court: Throughout the week, athletes will receive 18 hours of on-court development, helping them build the skills and habits necessary to get noticed by coaches, make the team, and become their best.
  • Off-court: RYG Basketball Camp includes 8 hours of classroom instruction, studying film to develop high basketball IQ, discussing leadership skills to help their teams win, and establishing the resilient mindset necessary to become a top-performing athlete.

Registration is open and spots are limited! The early bird price of $395 expires on Jun 1. Register your hooper and find a FREE preview of camp HERE.
node.name: RYG Basketball Camp

node.description:
Join Startup Junkie for a special networking happy hour at Orthodox Farmhouse Brewery in Elkins next Tuesday, Jul 25, at 6p.

  • Celebration: Orthodox Farmhouse Brewery recently received a $5000 "Marquee" Grant from Upstart Thrift Store — a nonprofit connected to Startup Junkie with the goal of helping provide financial support to local small business owners.
  • On the house: Whether you're an entrepreneur, work in the local business community, or just want to network with some of the awesome people in this space, you’re welcome to join! And drinks are on the house!

RSVP for free networking and great beer HERE.
node.name: Networking Happy Hour At Orthodox Farmhouse Brewery

node.description: Kansas City Jazz Ensemble HORACESCOPE will transform Crystal Bridges’ Great Hall into an intimate jazz club with live music and handcrafted drinks on Jul 28.
node.name: Kansas City Jazz Ensemble HORACESCOPE

node.description:
Siloam Springs will celebrate this month's Fourth Friday with the theme ART FEST at Memorial Park on Jul 28 from 4-8:30p.

  • Paint the town: Gather with the community for a night of live music, food trucks, free activities, local crafters, small businesses, and fun with other artsy fartsy folks.
  • Where art thou: Enjoy live music on the library promenade from 4-6p and get your picture drawn by a caricaturist from 5-7p! Then gather around at Chautauqua Amphitheater for a live performance featuring Samantha Crain at 6:30p.

Find more information about ART FEST HERE.
node.name: Siloam Springs Fourth Friday ART FEST

node.description:
The Johnson Square Summer Series continues this Friday, Jul 28, filling the streets with games, giveaways, and live music starting at 7p.

  • Party Time: The summer series takes place every fourth Friday through August, providing opportunities to grab food and beverages from nearby restaurants like Hail Fellow Well Met! and Pizzeria Ruby while enjoying live music and time with the local Johnson community.
  • On Stage: This month’s free live music performance will feature the intimate acoustic tracks and psychedelic-inspired guitar riffs of Kin & Company. Check out these local artists before the show on Spotify or Soundcloud!

Find more event details for this Friday HERE.
node.name: Johnson Square Summer Series

node.description:
Celebrate the rich diversity of Pacific Island cultures with immersive activities during the annual Stroll The Atolls Festival at Shiloh Square in Downtown Springdale on Saturday, Jul 29, from 10a-9p.

  • Hello / Iakwe: The festival, organized by the Arkansas Coalition of Marshallese, aims to celebrate the rich culture of the Pacific Islands while educating the community about the diaspora of the Marshallese in Arkansas and the broader Pacific Islander community in Northwest Arkansas.
  • Woven Together: The event will begin with an interactive weaving workshop at 10a, where guests can observe Marshallese weaving demonstrations and even try their hands at weaving. The festival continues with live music, traditional dances, art displays, and mouthwatering Island food!

Find more Stroll the Atolls details HERE.
node.name: Stroll the Atolls Festival

node.description:
Support CSC during the 16th annual Dream BIG Charity Gala at the Fayetteville Town Center on Jul 29. This year's circus-themed gala will feature live music with Boom Kinetic, Cirque acts, carnival games, and live & online auctions. Proceeds support the ongoing work of the CSC.


Reserve tickets for the Dream Big Charity Gala HERE.
node.name: 16th Annual Dream BIG Charity Gala

node.description:
Find community while pursuing fitness goals by joining Movement Class at the ArtCourt on Dickson in Fayetteville, led by movement coach Philip Shepherd every Saturday at 10:30a from May 6 - Sep 23. 

  • Let’s get moving: Movement Classes include exercise drills intended to improve joint health and range of motion while building full-body strength and coordination through fun, interactive, and accessible workouts. 
  • All together now: Community is key to reaching fitness goals no matter where you’re starting your journey. All exercises can be scaled down for beginners or scaled up to more difficult variations, and teamwork is highly encouraged. 

Everyone's first class is FREE, and affordable pricing begins at $10 per class, a four-class pass for $30, and 12 classes for $75. Learn more about Movement Class HERE.
node.name: Movement Class at the ArtCourt

node.description:
The University of Arkansas Museum will host Family Night at the Museum, featuring artifacts ranging from meteorites and dinosaurs to ancient Roman coins and first computers, this Saturday, Jul 29, from 5-10p.

  • History Buffs: Explore the museum’s fascinating collection and meet amazing community partners from the Arkansas Air and Military Museum, Arkansas Archeological Survey, UARK Isely Baerg Entomology Club, and UARK Space Hogs.
  • Night at the Museum: Bring your friends and family to enjoy the museum, interactive games, and immersive crafts. This is a great opportunity for family fun or for K-12 educators to discover valuable museum resources. Bring your outdoor chairs and blankets, the evening will end with an outdoor movie featuring The Good Dinosaur.

RSVP for Family Night at the Museum HERE.
node.name: Family Night at the Museum

node.description: 🐓 I believe I can fly: Central BBQ will host the first ever Fayetteville Feather Fest wing eating competition on Saturday, Jul 29, from 12-2p. You ready to fly?
node.name: Fayetteville Feather Fest Wing Eating Competition

node.description:
Founded by Scott and Carolyn Crook in 1973, Pack Rat Outdoor Center will host its 50th Anniversary Celebration the week of Jul 23-29, including daily drawings for gift cards and a huge party on the 29th with food, music, and games!

  • Packed & ready: Pack Rat features a huge selection of gear and clothing for hiking, floating, climbing, and camping and provides services like pack fitting, gear repair, and roof rack, kayak & bike carrier installation.
  • Unpacked: Not just a gear store, the Outdoor Center is deeply embedded in the community and regularly hosts a variety of skills clinics and fundraising events, like Pint Nights each spring and fall, to support local nonprofits.
node.name: Pack Rat Outdoor Center 50th Anniversary Party

node.description:
Get ready for an energy-charged race day as the Arkansas State Criterium Championships speed through Downtown Springdale on Sunday, Jul 30, from 8a-3p.

  • Interest: Downtown Springdale has developed a reputation as a cycling criterium destination after three years of hosting the Natural State Criterium Series — the largest mid-week criterium in the country, attracting riders from as far away as Australia!
  • Desire: Explore Downtown businesses & restaurants as cyclists zoom down Emma Ave in this spectator-friendly race. Kids are encouraged to bring their bikes to an exciting Kids Zone hosted by Buddy Pegs.

Learn more about the Arkansas State Crit Championships HERE.
node.name: Arkansas State Criterium Championships

node.description: Celebrate Black Apple’s 8th Birthday Bash this Sunday, Jul 30! Pick up a Black Apple Day Passport for a crawl through participating Downtown establishments from 10a-5p. The first 50 to complete all tasks win a commemorative Black Apple Bash shirt. Stick around for the Birthday Bash at Black Apple from 6-8p.
node.name: Black Apple's 8th Birthday Bash

node.description:
Compete for prizes, network with other players, and support life-saving hydration education during the Beat the Heat Summer Swing at Lost Springs Golf Club in Rogers on Monday, Jul 31, at 8a.

  • Heating up: The golf tournament raises important funds to support the mission of Kendrick Fincher Hydration for Life to save lives by educating people on the importance of proper hydration and heat illness prevention.
  • Hitting the greens: Test your skills in this four-person scramble with cash prizes up for grabs for the top finishing team and individual contests like hole-in-ones, longest drives, and closest-to-the-pins. Plus, enjoy refreshments, snacks, and a delicious lunch provided by Sassy's BBQ.

Register your four-person dream team HERE.
node.name: Beat the Heat Summer Swing Golf Tournament

node.description:
August's First Thursday theme in Fayetteville is Summer Soirée! There will be laid-back summer jams and plenty of fun in the sun at the Downtown Square Aug 3, from 5:30-9p.

  • All Summer Long: First Thursday on the Square is an annual event series by Experience Fayetteville intended to gather the community around the combination of music, food, art, and fun! This month’s entertainment will feature Papa Rap, The Misdemeanors, and Bootleg Royale.
  • Summertime gladness: Celebrate long summer nights, outdoor dining, and childhood fun. Compete for prizes in a watermelon seed-spittin’ contest, grab dinn
  • er from a great lineup of food trucks, and let the kiddos play in the splash pad play area!

Find all the details for August’s First Thursday HERE.
node.name: Fayetteville First Thursday - Summer Soirée

node.description:
Spring is in the air, and that means Bentonville Square will soon come alive for First Friday, a family-friendly event that often welcomes as many as 10,000 people to the heart of Downtown Bentonville for a monthly block party.

  • 150 years young: Each month, the First Friday has a unique theme, and April will kick off the season by celebrating Bentonville's 150th anniversary.
  • Join the party: Vendor applications for the 2023 season are now open. Don't miss your chance to showcase your business or organization at Bentonville's monthly block party.

Learn more about First Friday HERE.
node.name: First Friday - Back to School

node.description:
Deck yourself out with glow gear and head to Crystal Bridges for the Art Trail at Night: Glow Party, as the Art trail is transformed into an imaginative light garden including music, food, artmaking, and more this Friday, Aug 4, from 8-11p.

  • After Sunset: Experience a one-of-a-kind sunset view at Skyspace, then explore themed artmaking stations or live music performance areas along the Art Trail.
  • Night Owls: Pop-up concessions and a bar area will serve late-night snacks and beverages. The event is free, and no reservation is required!

Find more information about the Glow Party HERE.
node.name: Art Trail at Night Glow Party

node.description:
Help the kids send off summer break with some fun during Bentonville's Back to School Themed First Friday celebration this weekend, with fun activities, delicious food trucks, and a fantastic lineup of live music at the Bentonville Square on Aug 3 from 3-9p.

  • Hit the Books: Enjoy a fun-filled evening with the community, including school supply giveaways, games, hands-on activities, and crafts for all ages throughout the Downtown Bentonville area.
  • Boot scootin’: A few unique experiences to expect during this month’s First Friday include the NWA BAT-MOB inflatable mobile batting cage, the NWA Rolling Video Games truck, a Hostess Donette Eating Contest at 5:45p, and live music headliner Handshake Saints at 7:30p.

Find more August First Friday details HERE.
node.name: Bentonville First Friday - Back to School

node.description:
Join an exciting yard art party featuring live music, artmaking, and refreshments in celebration of Audrey Vega's Yard Art Installation, Los Hermanos Vega: Rooted in Springdale, at the Live in America Residency House on Saturday, Aug 5, from 4-6p.

  • Familia: Featuring a mural and portrait painting that captures the essence of Springdale, Los Hermanos Vega: Rooted in Springdale showcases pays tribute to Vega’s grandmother and uncle, Virginia Vega and Eddie Vega, who dedicated themselves to supporting the Latino community in Springdale.
  • Art Party: The yard party will include live music, snacks, and free artmaking activities provided by the Shiloh Museum of Ozark History as part of its Shiloh Summer Series.

General Admission is free! Reserve your spot HERE.
node.name: Yard Art Party at Live in America Residency House

node.description:
The streets of Downtown Rogers will come alive with music this weekend as Butterfield Stage hosts the Railyard Live Jazz & Blues Block Party from Aug 4-5.

  • Fresh Friday: Friday’s lineup includes talented acts like Abstract Citizen, Dawn Cate Band, King Cabbage, and renowned bassist Michael Fields Jr.
  • Saturday Soul: The excitement continues on Saturday with the Austin Farnam Trio, Jeremy Thomas Quartet, YoungJoo Song Quartet, Jimmie Bratcher, and classically trained trumpeter Rodney Block.

Reserve your free tickets for the Jazz & Blues Block Party HERE.
node.name: Railyard Live Jazz & Blues Block Party

node.description:
The 124th Tontitown Grape Festival kicks off tomorrow night for a week of community fun, carnival rides, and great food lasting Aug 1-5.

  • Something for everybody: The festival schedule includes free nightly entertainment, traditional grape stomping, carnival rides, a craft fair, and the infamously delicious Italian Spaghetti Dinners and grape ice cream.
  • Move Your Feet: If all that grape stomping makes you want to move your feet, sign up for the Run for the Grapes 5K on Saturday morning. The Festival ends Saturday night with the Grand Prize Giveaway of a 2023 Honda Pioneer 1000, to be presented by this year’s Queen Concordia.

See the full festival schedule HERE.
node.name: 124th Tontitown Grape Festival

node.description:
Find community while pursuing fitness goals by joining Movement Class at the ArtCourt on Dickson in Fayetteville, led by movement coach Philip Shepherd every Saturday at 10:30a from May 6 - Sep 23. 

  • Let’s get moving: Movement Classes include exercise drills intended to improve joint health and range of motion while building full-body strength and coordination through fun, interactive, and accessible workouts. 
  • All together now: Community is key to reaching fitness goals no matter where you’re starting your journey. All exercises can be scaled down for beginners or scaled up to more difficult variations, and teamwork is highly encouraged. 

Everyone's first class is FREE, and affordable pricing begins at $10 per class, a four-class pass for $30, and 12 classes for $75. Learn more about Movement Class HERE.
node.name: Movement Class at the ArtCourt

node.description:
Dust off your bow and arrows for archery season at The Quiver and test your skills in the Quiver 300 Youth Competition on Aug 5 and the newly introduced Quiver 600 Adult Competition on Aug 6.

  • Bullseye: The Quiver at Osage Park in Bentonville offers memberships to a 70-meter outdoor archery range with 20 lanes for shooting practice. Equipment rentals are included with reservations, and certified archery instructors are on-site to provide coaching.
  • Take Aim: Each competition is divided into categories by age, experience, and bow types — compound, recurve, or barebow. Attend a free Quiver Competition Info Session on Jul 23 to get an overview of the competition, rules, and scoring.

Registration ranges from $20-40; the deadline is Aug 3. Sign up HERE.
node.name: Archery Competitions At The Quiver

node.description:
Fayetteville’s historic retreat center, Mount Sequoyah, will commemorate its 100th Anniversary with a mountaintop carnival and two Trout Fishing in America concerts on Saturday, Aug 5.

  • Carnies: Enjoy games, inflatables, crafts, activities, face painting, food truck fare, and refreshing snow cones during the carnival from 10a-5p.
  • Gone Fishin’: Trout Fishing in America will perform a kid-friendly concert at 2p in Clapp Auditorium. The band will return at 7p for an adult focussed sunset concert near the Cross Overlook.

Carnival tickets are $5, and concert tickets start at $15. Reserve yours HERE.
node.name: Mount Sequoyah 100th Anniversary Carnival + Concert

node.description:
Peddle up to the sixth-floor outdoor patio of the Ledger for a special Bike-In Cinema experience this summer on Aug 8 at 7p!

  • Built to ride: The world's first bikeable building, the Ledger features six stories of switchbacks along the copper exterior of its 230,000ft2 mixed-use space, which includes private offices, coworking space, retail, and art displays.
  • Honey & Jam: The Bike-In Cinema series will show Space Jam on Aug 8. Doors open at 6:30p, and movies begin at 7p. Don't forget your blankets and snacks! Concessions will be available for purchase.

Tickets are $8 a piece or $5 when you buy more than four. Reserve your spot HERE.
node.name: Bike-In Cinema At The Ledger

node.description:
This week’s Terrific Tuesdays event at the Botanical Garden of the Ozarks will be equal parts wild and chill. Join the free, family-friendly event in the garden on Aug 8 from 5-8:30p.

  • Chill Animals: Last week’s Amazing Animals program was postponed due to high temperatures, but the critters will make an appearance tomorrow night for the Ice Cream Social. Say hello to a 13ft python from Reptile Refuge, stop by a petting zoo from Greedy Goats, and meet various animals from Backyard Buddies.
  • Well, Hot Dog! Bring your blankets and lawn chairs for a picnic. Grab a hotdog from Atomic Dog and indulge in some mouthwatering Blue Bell ice cream. There will be water slides and sprinklers to help you cool off from the summer heat.

Terrific Tuesdays are free, but you’ll need to register HERE.
node.name: Terrific Tuesdays - Amazing Animals/Ice Cream Social

node.description:
Help raise funds for the Northwest Arkansas Food Bank and local food pantries by dining at your favorite Bentonville restaurants during the Square Meals event on Aug 9-10.

  • Feed the Hungry: Northwest Arkansas Food Bank provides nourishment to over 70,000 individuals in our region. Donations raised through Square Meals will go directly to nine NWA Food Bank-affiliated food pantries located in Bentonville.
  • Dine Together: On Aug 9-10, dine at one of the participating restaurants around Bentonville, like Oven & Tap, Bar Cleeta, or Flying Fish, and proceed from your meal will go towards feeding the whole community. You can also participate in Square Meals by donating online!

See the complete list of participating restaurants HERE.
node.name: Square Meals

node.description:
Art on the Bricks will be extra sweet this month with the celebration of National S’More’s Day and the first-ever American Love Project event in Northwest Arkansas this Thursday, Aug 10, from 4:30-7:30p.

  • For the Love: The Rogers Experimental House will host a free workshop and maker station led by Karen Blessen, founder of The American Love Project, on Thursday, Aug 10, from 2-3:30p. Started in 2021, the project was designed to plant seeds of love and compassion necessary for the work of repairing social wounds and divisions. 
  • S’more what? View works of art from the American Love Project while enjoying pop-up S’More’s Stations and related treats around Downtown Rogers. Over a dozen galleries, shops, and restaurants will be open, highlighting the artists in our community.

Find an interactive map to help find your way around Art on the Bricks HERE.
node.name: Art on the Bricks - Love & Chocolate

node.description:
Learn how to foxtrot and cha-cha real smooth during the Social Dance Night at Crystal Bridges this Friday, Aug 11, beginning at 7p.

  • May I Have This Dance: Instructors from Dance with Me Studio by Aura will provide dance lessons, teaching the rhythms, moves, styles, and steps.
  • The Dance Hall: Enjoy a professional dance performance, a group dance lesson at 7p, followed by social dancing from 8p to midnight in the beautiful Great Hall at Crystal Bridges.

Tickets are $12.50. Reserve your spot online HERE.
node.name: Social Dance Night at Crystal Bridges
node.organization: Dance with Me Studio by Aura

node.description:
The city of Rogers will celebrate the newly opened Mt. Hebron Park with a Grand Opening celebration and ribbon-cutting ceremony this weekend on Friday, Aug 11, at 10a.

  • Gathering Place: With trails, sports fields, and greenspace spanning 80 acres in the southwest corner of Rogers, Mt. Hebron Park will be a community center for sports, leisure, and recreation.
  • Welcome to Play: Mt. Hebron includes 8 pickleball courts, 4 tennis courts, 4 basketball courts, 2 turf soccer fields, and a turf baseball field. The park also features Arkansas’s largest accessible playground with state-of-the-art equipment and a splash pad made with ranging abilities in mind.

Learn more about Mt. Hebron Park HERE.
node.name: Mt. Hebron Park Grand Opening

node.description:
Find community while pursuing fitness goals by joining Movement Class at the ArtCourt on Dickson in Fayetteville, led by movement coach Philip Shepherd every Saturday at 10:30a from May 6 - Sep 23. 

  • Let’s get moving: Movement Classes include exercise drills intended to improve joint health and range of motion while building full-body strength and coordination through fun, interactive, and accessible workouts. 
  • All together now: Community is key to reaching fitness goals no matter where you’re starting your journey. All exercises can be scaled down for beginners or scaled up to more difficult variations, and teamwork is highly encouraged. 

Everyone's first class is FREE, and affordable pricing begins at $10 per class, a four-class pass for $30, and 12 classes for $75. Learn more about Movement Class HERE.
node.name: Movement Class at the ArtCourt

node.description:
Celebrate Dr. Neil Compton's 111th Birthday at Compton Gardens & Arboretum with a special viewing of the documentary First River on Saturday, Aug 12, at 10a.

  • Hometown Hero: Neil Compton, the founder of the Ozark Society, played a crucial role in preserving the Buffalo River by opposing the construction of dams. The film will be viewed at Dr. Compton’s former family home in Bentonville at 312 N Main Street.
  • Local Legend: First River explores the Buffalo River's designation as the first National River in 1972. Learn about one of our region’s outdoor wonders and honor a local hero who helped preserve its beauty for future generations.

Reserve your free tickets to celebrate our local conservation hero HERE.
node.name: “First River” Viewing

node.description:
Join the NWA Newbies for Brews, Bash, and Bazaar, featuring over ten local vendors at Rendevous Junction Brewing Co in Rogers this Saturday, Aug 12, from 12-5p.

  • Shop Around: Find a new hat from Brim & Band, sink your teeth into Hopwood Breads, spruce up your space with a new plant from Pink Fern Plant Co., update your riding apparel with Say Hi Cycling, and explore numerous other awesome local makers.
  • Take a Shot: Bree Hanan Photography will also be present if you want to update your headshots. Enjoy mimosas, non-alcoholic drinks, and food from Los Compas Food Truck while you explore local vendors and connect with neighbors!

Follow NWA Newbies for updates HERE.
node.name: Brews, Bash and Bazaar

node.description:
Join the Botanical Garden of the Ozarks for a presentation from delving into the fascinating world of the Diana Fritillary, the Arkansas State Butterfly, this Saturday, Aug 12, from 10-11a.

  • Compare & Contrast: Learn the difference between the Diana Fritillary and the more recognized Monarch butterfly. The presentation will be led by the esteemed Ms. Shawn Hunter, an NWA Master Naturalist, Ozark Wild One, and Co-Founder of The Diana Project.
  • Pollen Pals: Gain a deeper understanding of the importance of protecting Arkansas pollinators and gain valuable resources and insights needed to positively impact the local ecosystem.

Learn more and reserve your spot HERE.
node.name: The Diana Project

node.description:
Arkansas Soccer plays its final exhibition match against SIUE at Razorback Field this Saturday, Aug 12, at 6p. Fans get in free for a chance to see the team in action before the season begins.

  • Ranked: For the second-straight year, Arkansas Soccer will begin the season ranked No. 8 in the United Soccer Coaches poll — the fourth consecutive season the Hogs have been ranked in the top 15. Head coach Colby Hale led the team to an impressive Elite 8 appearance last season, finishing eighth in the nation.
  • Kick-Off: The regular season begins at Razorback Field on Aug 17 at 6:30p as Arkansas takes on Arkansas State for the start of what is sure to be another thrilling season.

Keep up with Arkansas Razorback Soccer HERE.
node.name: Free Exhibition Game - Arkansas Soccer

node.description:
Top female polo players compete for United States Polo Association honors to benefit the Girl Scouts Diamond Horse Camp in Huntsville, AR. Enjoy a champagne divot stomp at half-time in between chukkers while you mingle and brunch with friends or make new ones at the NWA Polo Club and Farm. Dress casual chic, and win prizes for best hat or divot stomping shoes! Food truck fare available for purchase.


Get your tickets HERE.
node.name: Chix with Stix Charity Polo Match

node.description:
Mark your calendars for the Best Friends For Vets event on Sunday, August 13th, from noon to 3 pm in downtown Springdale at Shiloh Square!

Service Dog trainers from IGY6 (I’ve Got Your Back) will be doing demonstrations. Come see Amanda Pipkin and her service dog, Combat, and learn more about service dog training for veterans in AR!

Come shop... for ALL doggie stuff, and support us with our silent auction and raffle for a 4-burner Griddle.!

Lunch $10

Posting of Colors and National Anthem at Noon.
node.name: Best Friends for Vets

node.description:
The fourth annual SOAR NWA hot air balloon festival takes flight at the Benton County Fairgrounds on Aug 18-19, taking fun to new heights and opening up new avenues for our neighbors with disabilities.

  • Helping Others Fly: SOAR NWA raises funds for Open Avenues — a nonprofit that has been serving Northwest Arkansas since 1975 by providing employment opportunities for people with disabilities.
  • Take to the Skies: Enjoy a variety of events, including evening balloon glows, tethered balloon rides, a kid zone, circus performers, musical performances, helicopter rides, a beer garden, food vendors, and a car exhibit.

Tickets are on sale now! Prepare to take flight HERE.
node.name: SOAR NWA

node.description:
OZ Art NWA will celebrate the completion of Lakes and Rivers by artist Stefan Sagmeister with a community event at Ledger this Friday, Aug 18, from 5–7p.

  • Big Fish: Lakes and Rivers, a sculptural installation of two smallmouth bass, celebrates the robust outdoor recreation industry in Arkansas. The larger fish measures 93 ft long, the average length of a blue whale.
  • Come for a Swim: The free, family-friendly celebration will feature local vendors, activities, a mobile aquarium, casting exercises, water safety education, and paddleboarding exercises. Attendees will receive a free Wonders of the Waterways activity book.

Find more information about the event HERE.
node.name: Lakes and Rivers Art Installation Party

node.description: 🐛 Creepy Crawlies: The UofA’s Dept. of Entomology will host the 2023 Ozarks Bug Crawl at Historic Cane Hill this Saturday, Aug 19. Deep South BBQ food truck will be there for lunch!
node.name: 2023 Ozarks Bug Crawl
node.organization: U of A Dept. of Entomology

node.description:
Hatch Farm will host its 1st Annual Hatch Farm Peach Festival & Scottish Highland Cow Showcase at their farm in Wesley, between Goshen and Elkins, this Saturday, Aug 19, from 10a-9p.

  • A Real Peach: You might recognize Hatch Farm from local farmers’ markets, where they sell flowers, jams, blueberries, and other chemical-free produce. The farm’s not far from the recently opened Orthodox Farmhouse Brewery if you’ve been meaning to get out that way!
  • Lil’ Moo’s: The $10 entry fee includes a complimentary peach, one raffle entry for a $100 Hatch Farm gift card, and a day filled with live music, food trucks, vendors, and activities. Kids can enjoy a petting area with piglets and see the farm’s newest baby Highland cow.

Find more information about the Hatch Farm Peach Festival HERE.
node.name: Inaugural Hatch Farm Peach Festival & Scottish Highland Cow Showcase

node.description:
Update your houseplants and meet other green thumbs during the Ozark Plant Swap, hosted by Ozark Beer Company in Downtown Rogers, this Sunday, Aug 20, from 2-5p.

  • House Trained: This Swap will focus on house plants, so if you have any plants you're willing to part with, bring them along! You can also bring cuttings or seeds to exchange. And if you're not ready to let go of any plants, there will be plants available for purchase, too.
  • At the Bar: Pink Fern will have a booth showcasing beautiful terrariums, and By and By Studio will have a plant bar set up where you can choose a pot and plant and have it potted before you leave!

Find more details about Ozark Plant Swap HERE.
node.name: Ozark Plant Swap

node.description:
Right to Start, a national nonprofit based in Kansas City, will gather business leaders and entrepreneurs from around the nation for a Celebration of Entrepreneurship at The Momentary on Aug 22, from 10a-4:30p.

  • Join the Conversation: The NWA Summit will showcase the work of Arkansas entrepreneurs, unveil new regional data, and highlight policy-in-action. Attendees will actively contribute and collaborate with entrepreneurs and policymakers to expand future entrepreneurial opportunities.
  • Join the Fun: Network with other business leaders during this day-long summit, including a lunchtime marketplace of local artisans and musicians, including the Marshallese dance group Oceanwave, an aerial performer, and more.

Fuel your entrepreneurial journey and register for Right to Start’s NWA Summit HERE.
node.name: NWA Summit | Celebration of Entrepreneurship

node.description: A benefit celebration to honor local music and entertainment LIVING LEGEND, Brian Crowne of George's Majestic Lounge and VP of the Walmart AMP, with the “Friend of the Community Award” for his involvement, impact and commitment to live music, venues, music promotion, musical artists, bands, and music education. The Divas on Fire will headline the evening, with The Tina Cossey Band, opening. A live auction by The Auction Divas will highlight the night, with opportunities to bid on one of two incredible trips to Italy and other items.
node.name: A Crowne-Ing Affair
node.organization: The Music Education Initiative and the Fayetteville Public Library

node.description:
To recognize and honor local music and entertainment LIVING LEGEND, Brian Crowne (of George's Majestic Lounge) and VP of the Walmart AMP, with the “Friend of the Community Award” for his involvement, impact and commitment to Live Music, venues, music promotion, musical artists, bands, and music education.


The Divas on Fire will headline the evening, with The Tina Cossey Band, opening.


A live auction by The Auction Divas will highlight the night, with opportunities to bid on one of two incredible trips to Italy


Learn more HERE.

node.description: 🏕️ Picture This: A starry night, a crackling campfire, and a good old-fashioned sing-along… All part of the Community Campout on Aug 25-26 at The Jones Center! This night of outdoor fun includes campfire cooking, smores, storytelling, games, live music, and more in a safe and secure campsite perfect for families with young children. Register HERE.
node.name: Community Campout at the Jones Center

node.description:
No suits or sequins required!

Enjoy a summer-casual evening with delicious food, drinks, and a live auction while supporting a good cause! Purchasing tickets to the Jewels of Giving Celebration will support the Northwest Arkansas Food Bank mission to feed hungry people.


The event will take place at the Heron Crest Events Center in Elm Springs on Friday, Aug 25, at 6p.


www.nwafoodbank.org/events
node.name: Jewels of Giving Celebration

node.description: 🚗 Need for Speed: The NWA Corvette Club will host its Summer’s End Corvette Show this Saturday, Aug 26, at Pinnacle Hills Promenade, benefitting the NWA Food Bank and Altrusa International.
node.name: Summer’s End Corvette Show

node.description:
The Remembering Nicholas Foundation will celebrate its namesake’s third birthday during the 3rd Annual Go Blue Cocktail Fundraiser on Aug 26 at Shadow Valley Country Club, raising funds for its ongoing support of families suffering infant loss and infant safety education.

  • A Hand to Hold: The Remembering Nicholas Foundation provides support to families suffering infant loss, assisting financially with hospital bills, funeral expenses, and counseling, and providing emotional guidance during their time of bereavement.
  • Happy Birthday: The 3rd Annual Go Blue Cocktail Fundraiser is an annual celebration to honor Nicholas' earthly birthday and all of his angel friends. The event will include a silent auction, open bar, and live music, with proceeds covering education for childcare providers in SIDS and Safe Sleep Awareness, Pediatric CPR, and First Aid Certifications.

Reserve tickets for the Go Blue Cocktail Fundraiser HERE.
node.name: 3rd Annual Go Blue Cocktail Fundraiser

node.description:
It's time for Ferris wheels, funnel cakes, petting zoos, and more as the Washington County Fair takes off this week, open from 10a-10p daily from Aug 22-26.

  • State Title: Founded in 1857, the Washington County Fair is Arkansas's largest county fair. Enjoy carnival rides, cheer on Miss Washington County Fair Pageant participants, and enjoy free petting zoos. There’s something for everyone!
  • Join the Fun: Admission is $5 cash or $7.50 card per person for ages six and up. Children under five are admitted for free, and armbands with unlimited ride access can be purchased for $30. On Friday, the carnival will stay open until 2a for Midnight Madness!

For more information, click HERE.
node.name: Washington County Fair

node.description:
Celebrate National Black Business Month at the Black Owned NWA Business Expo at the Fayetteville Town Center & Fayetteville Town Square this Saturday, Aug 26, from 5-9p.

  • Build Community: The Expo provides a physical and digital platform for Black businesses, events, and resources with the goal of helping members of the Black Community thrive in Northwest Arkansas.
  • Shop Local: Explore over 100 vendors from the region, featuring items ranging from vintage clothing and candles to baked goods, hot tea, and samosas. The event is free and open to the public.

Reserve your free tickets to the Black Owned NWA Business Expo HERE.
node.name: Black Owned NWA Business Expo

node.description:
Spring is in the air, and that means Bentonville Square will soon come alive for First Friday, a family-friendly event that often welcomes as many as 10,000 people to the heart of Downtown Bentonville for a monthly block party.

  • 150 years young: Each month, the First Friday has a unique theme, and April will kick off the season by celebrating Bentonville's 150th anniversary.
  • Join the party: Vendor applications for the 2023 season are now open. Don't miss your chance to showcase your business or organization at Bentonville's monthly block party.

Learn more about First Friday HERE.
node.name: First Friday - In Motion

node.description:
Bentonville’s First Friday theme for September is “In Motion” — a celebration of all the things that get us moving sponsored by Segway, who will be present with their latest F-SE and the C15 kickscooter models for folks to test drive. Join the fun this Friday, Sep 1, from 3-9p.

  • To the Skies: Get your heart pounding with the Flippenout Trampoline Show as trampoline artists take to the sky, and enjoy music from DJ Girlfriend. The evening’s headliner, Kris Allen, takes the stage from 7:30-9p.
  • On the Move: Play with tinkering stations from the Amazeum, learn about the physics of bicycles with NWA Space and Science Center, join a dance lesson, or burn some calories with several local gym leaders. There will be something for everyone to enjoy this First Friday.

Find more September First Friday details HERE.
node.name: Bentonville First Friday - In Motion

node.description: 🦐 Let’s Boil: Enjoy shrimp, crab, potatoes, corn, beer, and community during the inaugural Ozark Beer Company Shrimp Boil this Sunday, Sep 3, from 12-5p.
node.name: Ozark Beer Company Shrimp Boil

node.description:
Learn more about our community and how you can help impact lasting change during the 5th Annual Coordinate NWA Summit, featuring dynamic teachers, interactive sessions, and ample networking opportunities at The Ledger in Bentonville on Sep 7.

  • Invaluable Insights: During this immersive full-day event, industry experts and thought leaders will explore crucial topics like Compassion Fatigue, Cultivating Organizational Health and Culture, Building Affordable Communities for a Booming Region, and more.
  • Next Level Leadership: Elevate your leadership potential and learn how to enact positive change in our community. Breakfast and lunch will be provided by Table Mesa and Tavola, and the Summit will conclude with a Happy Hour where you can connect with other emerging leaders from the region.

The Summit is free, but space is limited. Reserve your spot today.
node.name: Coordinate NWA Summit

node.description:
Join our community partners & supporters for the official launch of Welcoming Week NWA 2023 at the Jones Center on Friday, Sep 8, from 9-10:30a.

We will share details about all the events happening during the week and ways to participate. Everyone is welcome, including project leaders, business supporters, media partners, and community members. We will be providing light refreshments and fun!

Learn more HERE.
node.name: Welcoming Week NWA Launch & Community Opening Celebration

node.description:
The NWA Startup Crawl is set to return to Fayetteville on Sep 8, where the best and brightest of Northwest Arkansas's dynamic entrepreneurial scene will showcase their products and services alongside local breweries, art displays, food trucks, and live music from Grammy-nominated band Sister Hazel.

  • Empower others: Organized by local nonprofit Startup Junkie, the NWA Startup Crawl draws hundreds of attendees each year, ranging from investors and business leaders to students and entrepreneurs who want to support and learn from each other.
  • Downtown: The festivities will begin at 5p on the Fayetteville Square, where the headlining stage and a beer garden will be set up; then, the crawl will lead attendees to the Pryor Center, where dozens of Arkansas-based startups will be set up for meet and greets.

Early bird tickets are available now for a discounted rate HERE.
node.name: NWA Startup Crawl

node.description:
Looking to update your personal library but don’t want to break the bank? Mark your calendar for the NWA Book Swap at The Apollo in Downtown Springdale on Sep 9, from 6-9p.

  • A Real Page-Turner: Nearly 2 billion books are printed each year in the U.S., many of which are never read or, worse, end up in landfills. NWA Book Swap hopes to reduce book waste by connecting readers so they can trade gently-used books for new titles in a way that encourages more sustainable and accessible reading practices.
  • Real Life GoodReads: Meet other book lovers and hype up your favorite stories at the Recommendation Station. There will be local snacks, drinks, and desserts for purchase and a mini-makers market present.

Get tickets at the Early Bird Price of $20 before Aug 1 and receive an NWA Book Fest Tote bag!
node.name: NWA Book Swap

node.description:
The 4th Annual Tour de Tacos starts rolling this Saturday, Sep 9, bringing riders together around the love of cycling and food for a great cause!

  • Support: All rides start and finish at JUNK Brands in Bentonville and benefit women and families seeking economic independence through Dress for Success. Day-of-event registration will open at 6a on Saturday, so the last-minute tacos enthusiasts can still get in on the fun! 
  • Taco ’bout Fun: Tour de Tacos includes 62, 30, and 7-mile bike rides along the Razorback Greenway, with restaurants and businesses set up along the path to provide cyclists food and hydration. A Block Party will be set up at the finish line, where you can enjoy taco vendors, drinks, live music, and community booths.

Learn more HERE.
node.name: 4th Annual Tour de Tacos

node.description:
Discover your next musical obsession with the Live on the Green concert series at the Momentary! The fall vibes kick off this weekend with indie-rock stars Alvvays, joined by special guest Julia Jacklin this Saturday, Sep 9.

  • Dreams Tonite: Described by The New York Times as “an indie-rock band that wraps fuzzy layers of rock instrumentation around stories of hard lives and hurt feelings,” Alvvays combines sober songwriting with vibrant, dream-like melodies.
  • On the Green: Bring your folding chairs and blankets and enjoy the fall evening to the sound of live music on the Momentary Green. Grab a bite at the Momentary Food Truck and a fun beverage from the RØDE Bar before and during the show!

Get your tickets today at theMomentary.org/Music
node.name: Alvvays with Julia Jacklin on the Momentary Green

node.description:
Get in the spirit of the school season with Best Friends' Bark to School Bash at the Pet Resource Center in Bentonville this Saturday, Sep 9, from 10a-4p!

  • State of the Bark: If you haven't been to the state-of-the-art Pet Resource Center yet, now’s your chance! Grab a drink from Third Space Coffee, play with kittens, take a slide downstairs to visit the pups, and meet the team working to make Arkansas shelters no-kill by 2025.
  • Doggone Fun: Meet dogs from Best Friends and other area shelters during the Adoptable Dog Fair from 10a-1p, and enjoy plenty of fun activities throughout the day, like face painting, balloon animals, paint and plant your own catnip pot activity, storytime in the kitten room, a make-your-own dog treat station, and more!

Find more Bark to School details HERE.
node.name: Best Friends' Bark to School Bash

node.description:
The Botanical Garden of the Ozarks will celebrate the many cultures that make up the Northwest Arkansas community during the 7th Annual International Festival this Sunday, Sep 10, from 3-7p.

  • Come One, Come All: In conjunction with Welcoming Week NWA (Sep 8-17) — a series of events bringing together immigrants, refugees, and native-born residents to encourage inclusivity and collective prosperity. Experts will be present, sharing about resources for immigrants, refugees, and other marginalized communities.
  • Global Garden: Bring your picnic blankets and lawn chairs and enjoy dinner from one of several food truck vendors while witnessing traditional dances and musical performances on the Great Lawn. Take a stroll around the Garden and explore booths featuring arts and crafts, displays, and cultural items for sale.

The event is free, but you need to register online HERE.
node.name: 7th Annual International Festival

node.description: 🎨 Art Show: The Gardens at Osage Terrace, Arkansas’s first not-for-profit assisted living community, will host a unique art show and silent auction themed "A Season of Reflection” on Sep 14 from 5-7p.
node.name: A Season of Reflection | Art Show + Silent Auction

node.description:
Local artists will celebrate Hispanic Heritage Month during this month’s Art on the Bricks with art demonstrations, live music, dancing, and family-friendly activities all around Downtown Rogers this Thursday, Sep 14, from 4:30-7:30p. 

  • Hispanic Heritage: Join in the celebration and experience dance, music, and culinary delights from regional artists of Hispanic descent. Hosted by Downtown businesses and restaurants, the showcase features arts and crafts by Latino community members from nine countries.
  • Jazzy Fresh: The Music Depot will host a jazz performance by The Crusade Quartet from 5-7p alongside an exhibition and live painting by Mexican-American artist David Gomez — whose art reflects overcoming obstacles like language barriers, dyslexia, and a childhood stutter.

Find an interactive map to help find your way around Art on the Bricks HERE.
node.name: Art on the Bricks - Hispanic Heritage Month

node.description:
Join Center for Arkansas Farms & Food for a Happy Hour at the Farm, raising funds for the Farmers of Tomorrow fund, including signature cocktails, dishes made with food grown by Farm School students, and live music on Sep 14 from 5:30-7:30p at 1005 Meade Avenue in Fayetteville.

  • Seed Money: The Farmers for Tomorrow fund benefits graduates of the CAFF Farm School and Apprenticeship Program, providing seeds and tools for aspiring farmers after they acquire farmland. 
  • Farmraiser: Enjoy canapés made especially for the event using food grown by students on the farm and prepared by Chef Haley O’Brien while being serenaded by Dandelion Heart. Each guest will receive drink tickets for local beer, Arkansas wines, and a custom cocktail featuring Blackberries from the farm. 

Learn more about CAFF and reserve tickets HERE.
node.name: Happy Hour at the Farm Fundraiser

node.description:
Celebrate the work of Big Brothers Big Sisters NWA during the annual BIG Event, taking place at Osage House in Cave Springs on Thursday, Sep 14, at 6p.

  • Role Model: Big Brothers Big Sisters of Northwest Arkansas inspires the potential of youth by organizing one-to-one mentoring relationships that contribute to social and emotional development. The annual BIG Event celebrates the impact that BBBS makes in NWA and showcases the influence that our Bigs have in the community.
  • Big Time: Join the celebration and see who gets named Big & Little of the Year. This is a great opportunity to network with community leaders and learn how to get involved with BBBS. There will be an open bar, a sit-down dinner, and a silent/live auction.

Learn more and reserve your seat at the BIG Event HERE.
node.name: The BIG Event

node.description:
The 2nd Annual WOZ Sunset Summit returns to Bentonville Sep 15-17.

  • Join the ride: Join a group of top industry leaders and world-renowned coaches for a women-led weekend of rides, clinics, workshops, and discussions to build confidence and community around cycling.
  • Make friends: Tickets include access to the three-day event, including an opening reception Friday night, food and drinks on Saturday, a ticket to the Sunset Party at Ledger, and more. The event's fundraising efforts support year-round programs that break down barriers for women in cycling and promote women’s health and wellness.

Reserve your spot HERE.
node.name: WOZ Sunset Summit

node.description:
From art crawls and comedy shows to vendor fairs and a Monarch Butterfly Parade, Downtown Springdale’s ART WALK has something for everyone to enjoy on Sep 14-15, from 4-8p, and Sep 16, from 12-6p.

  • The Perfect Start: The three-day festival kicks off Sep 14 with an ART Crawl from 6-8p, including a drink, featured stops along the ART WALK, and artist meet & greets for just $5. Add some laughter to your Thursday night with Comedy Night at the Apollo on Emma, featuring the ART WALK Comedy Troupe. Shows start at 4p and 8p.
  • Take Flight: The Monarch Flight Festival will take place Sep 16 from 12-4p at Turnbow Park. A Monarch Parade at 3p will end with the release of newly hatched butterflies at Shiloh Museum. During the event, shop local vendors and artisans as part of the Emma Exchange at Shiloh Square, beginning at noon. 

Find more ART WALK details HERE.
node.name: Downtown Springdale ART Walk

node.description: The Monarch Flight Festival will take place Sep 16 from 12-4p at Turnbow Park. A Monarch Parade at 3p will end with the release of newly hatched butterflies at Shiloh Museum. During the event, shop local vendors and artisans as part of the Emma Exchange at Shiloh Square, beginning at noon.
node.name: Monarch Flight Festival

node.description:
A 36-year community tradition, the Cane Hill Harvest Festival pays tribute to Ozark culture with a day of live music, local artists, craft demonstrations, delicious food, and more on Saturday, Sep 16, from 8a-3p. 

  • Well, Butter my Biscuits: Kick off the day with an Ozark Country Breakfast, then explore the Arts and Eats Market, including vendors, sorghum pressing demonstrations, craft demonstrations, tours of historic buildings, and a quilt show. 
  • Family Friendly Fun: Children can enjoy the Kids Zone, offering free face painting and activities from the Amazeum, Shiloh Museum of Ozark History, the U of A Entomology Department, and more.

node.description:
The Walmart OZ Mile Swim is for ALL swimmers! Elite, experienced, novice, beginner - ALL! We have an ELITE wave, a YOUTH wave, an AGE GROUP wave, a PARA wave, and the OZ wave (wetsuits or safety buoys or even fins). Swimmers will have the option to complete 1 wave or multiple waves if they would like to increase their mileage. 


This event will be a FESTIVAL ATMOSPHERE unlike any other Open Water Race in the region - maybe the USA! There is something for everyone! 


We have collaborated with the World's largest Open Water Swim, the MIDMAR MILE. Our winners receive a trip to South Africa to compete in the 2024 event!


We will kick off race weekend on Friday afternoon, September 22nd with a Race Expo Presented by Century 21's Heartfelt Homes, at Red Barn in Bentonville. A meet and greet with all our swimmers, and elites. As well as local and national vendors. The Expo is free to attend, with adult beverages provided by Pabst Blue Ribbon.


This swim is set in the heart of the Ozarks, which offer fun adventures for the entire family! The festival like atmosphere is spectacular for swimmers and their families! There is a pre-swim offered on Saturday to stretch out from your travels so you are ready to go for Sunday. There is also an opportunity to learn from one of the best open water swimmers in the world, TWO time OLYMPIAN Michelle Weber, during her clinic. FREE to attend, courtesy of Pabst Blue Ribbon. We will have awards for the top 3 finishes in age groups for male and female, and Youth Team and Adult Masters Team awards. 


We can't wait to see you there!
node.name: Walmart OZ Mile Swim

node.description:
Pop In for the Artist Meet & Greet. Our last artist for the year 2023, Amy Rimmer who has completed her installation and it is ready for public viewing & purchase. Get up close and personal with the artist, munch on some local provisions and sip on some bubbly. This is a free event but must RSVP on Eventbrite.

Location: 308 W Emma Avenue Springdale, AR 72764 

Artist Bio

Amy Rimmer’s first taste of art competition came at the age of 12. Her grandmother and parents convinced her to put her Andy Warhol inspired sunflower pastel drawing into the County Fair Art Show. She won a blue ribbon. Her love for art only grew stronger. After graduating high school, she attended Bethany College as an art major. During the first semester, her grandfather was diagnosed with Stage 4 Prostate Cancer. Amy’s passion was put to the side as she dedicated time to

help care for her family. This heartbreaking time made Amy want to change career paths and transfer schools to obtain her Bachelors of Science in Nursing. After five years of working as a pediatric nurse, Amy started painting again. Her show “Joy” in the spring of 2017 was held in Connecticut for two months. She has also had local showings throughout Northwest Arkansas. She has been a vendor at several NWA markets; The Little Craft Show, Fifth Market, and Sleet City Market to name a few. Amy will be a vendor at the three day event, The Smoky Hill River Festival, in her hometown of Salina, Kansas, which has always been a dream of hers. She was also selected to have two pieces curated in America’s first ever Biennial Art and Fashion show, Assembly, in Springdale, Arkansas during June 2023. Beginning this fall, Amy will be the featured artist at The Apollo on Emma in Springdale, Arkansas. Amy currently resides in Fayetteville, Arkansas with her husband Thomas and their three children, Ayla, Luke and Alec, and their dog Ellie.

Learn more HERE.
node.name: CONNECTION - An Art Installation by Artist Amy Rimmer
